Blog.NewsItem.Text: {TCCN Ep# 332} / {News Stories}
Officially it is still {#SepTandy} -- I thought this was cool. Using his speakers to amplify the signal is genius! {CoCo to CoCo Data Transfer Using CSAVE and CLOAD}!
From {Canadian Retro Things} Very cool! A CoCo2 w/ a {256k Banker Switch CoCo 2: Part 1} never heard of it!
{Amigos Retro Gaming} released a video on {The Games Of Nick Marentes' - A TRS-80 Color Computer Tribute}
A great blog series by {Glen Hewlett}: How to setup and use IRQs on the TRS-80 Color Computer

Blog.NewsSubItem.Text: Part 1 – {What is an IRQ and when would I use it?}
Part 3 – {Can the IRQ run without effecting BASIC?}
Part 4 – {Simpler ways to use interrupts on the CoCo}
Part 5 – {Advanced interrupt settings and using CoCo 3 specific interrupts}

Blog.NewsItem.Text: {La CoCo Strangiato} released a new video: {SVI CAS - Houston, we have a problem!}
Boisy Pitre has been working on a new OS-9 Level 1 port to a project called {Foenix F256 Jr}. {Video} and {description} and {here} on FB.
{CoCoTECH Show} - a live and interactive discussion (w/ technical difficulties!!) about the finer technical topics of Color Computers, Dragons, MC-10, clones, and hardware cousins!
CoCo Town is going to improve his game: {Let's start improving that game! | Game revolutions cycle 1}
{TCCN Ep# 331} / {News Stories}

Interesting one from CoCo Town {Can I dial my CoCo into a BBS at 300 baud in 2023?}. I did not BBS until I had a PC and even then it was only about a half dozen times. I did telnet for a bit on Delphi before I got a local dial-up ISP w/ full-fledged internet access.
{Jason Thorpe} uploaded an update of his 6809 Playground SBC: {6809 Playground - PETSCII Robots mini update 0}

{ACs 8-Bit Zone} uploaded a cool video: {Building a Mechanical Keyboard from Scratch}. He does not say if plans on selling any. We’ll see. It would be cool if he made it open-source, however, it looks like it might be somewhat easy to duplicate w/ a little experience as an electronic maker.
{TCCN Ep# 330} / {News Stories}

A couple noteworthy videos from {Dave and Sharron Veary}: {Coco 3 Sprites for #Septandy with code}. And {Editing Sprite Code with Edtasm}. Some very interesting info to be gleamed from these. Quite a few other Assembly Language videos, so check them out. (Also a lot of digital simulations I find interesting!)
Good year old video review about the CoCo3! {Exploring the Color Computer 3} and {Testing the Power of the Color Computer 3}.

Jason Thorpe is creating an awesome series of videos on a 6809 build he is working on. {6809 Playground}. And he has a {GitHub} site w/ the design files, which is very cool! I just stumbled across this project and look forward to following and studying along w/ him.
{TCCN Ep# 329} / {News Stories}
CoCo Town resurrects a game he started when in high school

Blog.NewsSubItem.Text: {That old assembly language game I never finished | Part 1}
{How a naïve high schooler managed sprites | Part 2}
{Screen scrolling and the main loop | Part 3}

Blog.NewsItem.Text: {La CoCo Strangiato} has a new video: {HDMI On Board!} | {HDMI On Board - Part 2}
{ACs 8-Bit Zone} has new vides:

Blog.NewsSubItem.Text: {Dragons, Cocos, and Tanos. All digital video output}
{Best Composite Mod. Tandy versus Mark Data Products}

Blog.NewsItem.Text: {Sixxie} has created a {Dragon 64 Motherboard Build} which is very cool and if I ever get around to it would like to build one myself. Kudos for making it a open source! {Dragon 64 motherboard}
{CMOC 0.1.85 Announcement}! I need to get into this and write a couple things for the CoCo using it.
{TCCN Ep# 328} / {News Stories}
ChibiAkumas final episode on his series on the Hitachi 6309: {6309 Lesson 3 - More new commands!}.
CoCo Town is on a roll again!! {Debugging your CoCo assembly with the original source} | {Peering inside DISK BASIC's storage, or... nerd heaven?}. Good stuff!
Another good video from CoCo Town: {Learning to read disk files with assembly | Asm Adventures} -- UPDATE: {What did I get wrong in my last video on Disk IO?}
There was some discussion on the {TC-9} / {TC-70} on facebook recently as someone was {selling a TC-9}. The combo is very interesting. I love the idea of a 68k/6809 processor combo.
{TCCN Ep# 327} / {News Stories}
ChibiAkumas continues his series on the Hitachi 6309: {6309 Lesson 2 - Shifts, Compares and logical ops}.

ChibiAkumas has created many retro programming tutorials, including for the 6809: {Learn 6809 Assembly}. Recently he has started a series on the Hitachi 6309: {Lesson 1 - Getting started with 6309 Assembly}
{TCCN Ep# 326} / {News Stories}

Reading posts on the {CoCo3FPGA} {Mail List} I found it’s possible to create your own analog board with the files found here: {2022 Coco 3fpga Collection}. Very cool! I actually have an analog board I {bought from Ed}, however it’s nice having the design files + schematics + the open source FPGA code.
New {VCC v2.1.0.8 announced}. {GitHub Release} -- looks like some good updates!!
More Coco Town ASM adventure: {Three visual sorts, ROM's timer, and interrupts | Asm Adventures}
{TCCN Ep# 325} / {News Stories}
I had no idea that EEVblog did a review of the CoCo1 (5 years ago)! {Retro Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer}.
This is a cool demo of FLEX for the CoCo! {FHL Color FLEX 1984 RainbowFest Demo}. That was powerful for that time-frame!
This looks very interesting! {Can We Use the TZXDuino With a Tandy Color Computer?}
Two more from CoCo Town: {Visualizing how Insertion Sort works} | {Insertion Sort assembly language bug | Asm Adventures}
{TCCN Ep# 324} / {News Stories}
I ran across these due to a comment on Facebook, I had forgotten about them. I recall when he made them 4 years ago.

Good video from Paul Thayer showing the process and tools he uses to create sound for a CoCo game: {SHMUP Update vlog}. Nice!! The demo shoot-em-up he plays looks and sounds great. There's quite the learning curve to creating sound effects on the CoCo.
More technical goodness from CoCo Town. {RAM Vectors and that "sticky POKE" | Asm Adventures}
{TCCN Ep# 323} / {News Stories}
Another fascinating, technical, and well done video from CoCo Town. {Recursion to the lowest level}
